forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 54. Southwest wind around 8 mph.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.shortForecast: Partly Sunny then Chance Light Rain
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain after 5pm. Partly sunny, with a high near 62. South southwest wind 8 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%.

weather_report:
Tonight in Downtown San Francisco finds us enveloped in a gentle embrace of partially cloudy skies, a calm interlude before the potential for rain the coming day. As evening beckons, temperatures will settle near a comfortable 54 degrees, accompanied by a whispering southwest breeze at around 8 mph. The atmosphere is relatively clear yet hints at an impending marine layer that typically blankets the city in fog—an ever-present character of coastal San Francisco. 

Looking toward Wednesday, the day promises a mix of mild moments and a projected chance of light rain after 5 PM, as clouds will dance across the heavens, allowing for brief displays of sunshine among the clouds. With a high nearing 62 degrees and winds gaining strength from the south-southwest at 8 to 14 mph, visitors may feel a touch of the typical brisk air that gives our city its signature coolness. For those choosing evening outings, a light jacket would serve well against the growing chill, as the wind picks up its pace. It’s an ideal time to explore the quieter corners of the city, perhaps winding your way through the softly whispering streets, indulging in an intimate dinner at a local eatery, or simply enjoying the mellow ambiance from a cozy café window, as daylight fades into night.
